    • Method Detail

      • htmlify

        public static String htmlify(String text)
        Performs the htmlNewline(String) and htmlLinks(String) methods against the given text.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to substitute.
        Returns:
        the substituted text.

      • htmlLinks

        public static String htmlLinks(String text)
        Substitutes links in the given text with valid HTML mark-up. For instance, http://dhis2.org is replaced with http://dhis2.org, and www.dhis2.org is replaced with www.dhis2.org.
        Parameters:
        text - the text to substitute links for.
        Returns:
        the substituted text.

      • htmlNewline

        public static String htmlNewline(String text)
        Replaces common newline characters like \n, \r, \r\n to the HTML line break tag
        .
        Parameters:
        text - the text to substitute.
        Returns:
        the substituted text.

      • getTokens

        public static List<String> getTokens(String string)
        Returns a list of tokens based on the given string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string.
        Returns:
        the list of tokens.

      • subString

        public static String subString(String string,
               int beginIndex,
               int length)
        Gets the sub string of the given string. If the beginIndex is larger than the length of the string, the empty string is returned. If the beginIndex + the length is larger than the length of the string, the part of the string following the beginIndex is returned. Method is out-of-range safe.
        Parameters:
        string - the string.
        beginIndex - the zero-based begin index.
        length - the length of the sub string starting at the begin index.
        Returns:
        the sub string of the given string.

      • removeLast

        public static String removeLast(String string,
                int characters)
        Removes the last given number of characters from the given string. Returns null if the string is null. Returns an empty string if characters is less than zero or greater than the length of the string.
        Parameters:
        string - the string.
        characters - number of characters to remove.
        Returns:
        the substring.

      • removeLastOr

        public static String removeLastOr(String string)
        Removes the last occurence of the word "or" from the given string, including potential trailing spaces, case-insentitive.
        Parameters:
        string - the string.
        Returns:
        the chopped string.

      • removeLastAnd

        public static String removeLastAnd(String string)
        Removes the last occurence of the word "and" from the given string, including potential trailing spaces, case-insentitive.
        Parameters:
        string - the string.
        Returns:
        the chopped string.

      • removeLastComma

        public static String removeLastComma(String string)
        Removes the last occurence of comma (",") from the given string, including potential trailing spaces.
        Parameters:
        string - the string.
        Returns:
        the chopped string.

      • trimEnd

        public static String trimEnd(String value,
             int length)
        Trims the given string from the end.
        Parameters:
        value - the value to trim.
        length - the number of characters to trim.
        Returns:
        the trimmed value, empty if given value is null or length is higher than the value length.

      • getString

        public static String getString(String string,
               boolean emptyString)
        Returns an empty string if the given argument is true, the string otherwise. This is a convenience method.
        Parameters:
        string - the string.
        emptyString - whether to return an empty string.
        Returns:
        a string.

      • getCommaDelimitedString

        public static String getCommaDelimitedString(Collection<?> elements)
        Transforms a collection of Integers into a comma delimited String. If the given collection of elements are null or is empty, an empty String is returned.
        Parameters:
        elements - the collection of Integers
        Returns:
        a comma delimited String.

      • join

        public static <T> String join(List<T> list,
              String separator,
              T nullReplacement)
        Joins the elements of the provided array into a single String containing the provided list of elements.
        Parameters:
        list - the list of objects to join.
        separator - the separator string.
        nullReplacement - the value to replace nulls in list with.
        Returns:
        the joined string.

      • getCommaDelimitedString

        public static String getCommaDelimitedString(Collection<?> elements,
                             boolean delimitPrefix,
                             boolean delimitSuffix)
        Transforms a collection of Integers into a comma delimited String. If the given collection of elements are null or is empty, an empty String is returned.
        Parameters:
        delimitPrefix - whether to prefix the string with a delimiter.
        delimitSuffix - whether to suffix the string with a delimiter.
        elements - the collection of Integers
        Returns:
        a comma delimited String.

      • getQuotedCommaDelimitedString

        public static String getQuotedCommaDelimitedString(Collection<String> elements)
        Transforms a collection of strings into a comma delimited string, where each component get single-quoted.
        Parameters:
        elements - the collection of Integers
        Returns:
        a comma delimited String.

      • splitSafe

        public static String splitSafe(String string,
               String separator,
               int index)
        Gets the string at the given index of the array produced by splitting the given string on the given separator. Returns null if the given string is null or if the given index is out of bounds of the array.
        Parameters:
        string - the string to split.
        separator - the character to split on.
        index - the index of the string in the resulting array to return.
        Returns:
        a string.
